subtitleNullable: A crawled dataset from 03/2016-07/2021 with ~268.000 entries
descriptionNullable:
### Context

Every day thousands of news articles with different political orientations are released.
The goal of this project is to create a dataset based on a high amount of news articles, which are clustered by their topics. This will provide useful information about the focus of news media during different timeframes.
This project has been a part of the course Key Competencies in Computer Science at the University of Wuppertal to annotate a Crossdocument Coreference Resolution Model and was supervised by Anastasia Zhukova.


### Content

The dataset consists of ~268.000 American news articles from 03/2016 to 07/2021. The websites chosen are based on the POLUSA dataset to ensure a diverse political spectrum. Each entry contains the title, maintext, release date and other parameters.


### Acknowledgements

This project has been supervised by Anastasia Zhukova.
The website domains chosen are based on the POLUSA dataset:
Lukas Gebhard and Felix Hamborg. 2020. The POLUSA Dataset: 0.9M Political News Articles Balanced by Time and Outlet Popularity. In Proceedings of the ACM/IEEE Joint Conference on Digital Libraries in 2020 (JCDL '20). Association for Computing Machinery, New York, NY, USA, 467–468. DOI:https://doi.org/10.1145/3383583.3398567
The json layout follows the news-please format:
Felix Hamborg. 2020. Newsplease Json Format. https://github.com/fhamborg/news-please/blob/master/newsplease/examples/sample.json


### Inspiration

Every day thousands of news articles with different political orientations are released.
This dataset can be used to get analysed and clustered. This will provide useful information about the focus of news media during different timeframes.
